definitions.definition: A beat or blow; the sound of beating.
Thrash metal
To beat mercilessly.
To defeat utterly.
To thresh.
To move about wildly or violently; to flail; to labour.
To extensively test a software system, giving a program various inputs and observing the behavior and outputs that result.
In computer architecture, to cause poor performance of a virtual memory (or paging) system.
The study of the effects of geography (especially economic geography) on international politics.
(now sometimes offensive) A young female weather forecaster
(especially of food) Characteristic of Capri, including Caprese salad
A random signal (or process) with a flat power spectral density; a signal with a power spectral density that has equal power in any band, at any centre frequency, having a given bandwidth.
(nontechnically) Any nondescript noise used for background or to mask or drown out other noise.

Any of various insects of the order Dermaptera that have elongated bodies, large membranous wings folded underneath short leathery forewings and a pair of large pincers protruding from the rear of the abdomen.
One who whispers insinuations; a secret counsellor.
A flatterer.
To fill the mind of with prejudice by insinuations.
To attempt to influence by persistent confidential argument or talk.
To eavesdrop.
To eavesdrop on.
A person who grew up with a particular language as their mother tongue.
definitions.example: Native speakers of English get paid much more than locals in the schools.

definitions.definition: A type of small, oily fish of the genus Clupea, often used as food.
Fish in the family Clupeidae.
Fish similar to those in genus Clupea, many of those in the order Clupeiformes.
A small mountain lake, especially in Northern England.
(chiefly Montana) One of many small mountain lakes or ponds.
Any substance that cannot be dissolved.
That cannot be dissolved.
That cannot be solved; unsolvable; insolvable.
That cannot be explained; mysterious or inexplicable.
That cannot be broken down or dispersed.
A polyhedron with four faces; the regular tetrahedron, the faces of which are equal equilateral triangles, is one of the Platonic solids.
A dish prepared this way.
To cook (food) using a small amount of fat in an open pan over a relatively high heat, allowing the food to brown and form a crust stopping it from sticking to the pan as it cooks.
To fall into ruin or disuse.
To cause to become ruined or put into disrepair.
To squander or waste.
Having fallen into a state of disrepair or deterioration, especially through neglect.
The act of validating something.
Something, such as a certificate, that validates something; attestation, authentication, confirmation, proof or verification.
The process whereby others confirm the validity of one's emotions.
The process of identifying a new prisoner's gang affiliation.
An ax having both a blade and a hammer face; used to slaughter cattle.
A long-handled battle axe, being a combination of ax, hammer and pike.
To fell someone with, or as if with, a poleaxe.
To astonish; to shock or surprise utterly.
A sudden motion or shock caused by an unexpected alarm, surprise, or apprehension of danger.
To move suddenly, or be excited, on feeling alarm; to start.
definitions.example: a horse that startles easily

definitions.definition: To excite by sudden alarm, surprise, or apprehension; to frighten suddenly and not seriously; to alarm; to surprise.
To deter; to cause to deviate.
A style of Jamaican dance music combining elements of Caribbean calypso and mento with American jazz and rhythm and blues.
To spew saliva as foam.
To rage, vent one's anger.
Pompous, officious talk.
A gust of wind.
Fitful noise and violence.
To speak or protest loudly.
definitions.example: When confronted by opposition his reaction was to bluster, which often cowed the meek.

definitions.definition: To act or speak in an unduly threatening manner.
To blow in strong or sudden gusts.
The visible part of the ear that resides outside of the head, the auricle; outer ear excluding the ear canal.
A leaflet or primary segment of a pinnate compound leaf.
A feather, wing, fin, or other similar appendage.
A meeting between two people or groups.
Having two sides.
Involving both sides equally.
(of an agreement) Binding on both of the two parties involved.
Having bilateral symmetry.
Involving descent or ascent regardless of sex and side of the family.
A heater, a closed apparatus to burn fuel for the warming of a room.
A device for heating food, (UK) a cooker.
A hothouse (heated greenhouse).
A house or room artificially warmed or heated.
To heat or dry, as in a stove.
definitions.example: to stove feathers

definitions.definition: To keep warm, in a house or room, by artificial heat.
definitions.example: to stove orange trees

definitions.definition: To fit or furnish with staves or rundles.
(usually with 'in') To break in the staves of; to break a hole in; to burst.
definitions.example: to stave in a cask

definitions.definition: (with 'off') To push, or keep off, as with a staff.
(usually with 'off') To delay by force or craft; to drive away.
definitions.example: We ate grass in an attempt to stave off our hunger.

definitions.definition: (rare or archaic) To burst in pieces by striking against something.
To walk or move rapidly.
To suffer, or cause to be lost by breaking the cask.
To render impervious or solid by driving with a calking iron.
definitions.example: to stave lead, or the joints of pipes into which lead has been run

definitions.definition: The region of the field between the infield and the outer fence.
The region of the field roughly outside of the infield or the wicket-keeper, slips, gully, point, cover, mid off, mid on, midwicket and square leg.
Arable land continually cropped without being manured.
Any open field at a distance from the farmsteading.
To perform better in defense (fielding).
A sentence of imprisonment for the rest of the defendant's life.
To remove by pulling.
definitions.example: As soon as she got home, she pulled off her clothes.

definitions.definition: To achieve; to succeed at something difficult.
definitions.example: Six pages is a lot to write in one night. Do you think she can pull it off?

definitions.definition: To turn off a road (onto the side of the road, or onto another road).
definitions.example: After about a mile, we pulled off the main road onto a dirt track.

definitions.definition: (of a vehicle) To begin moving and then move away; to pull away.
definitions.example: As the police approached, the car pulled off and sped away into the distance.

definitions.definition: To masturbate.
A cocktail made with tequila, crème de cassis, lime juice and soda water
A cocktail made with tequila, orange juice and grenadine syrup
A mariner or sailor, one who mans a ship. Opposed to landman or landsman.
A person of the lowest rank in the Navy, below able seaman.
An enlisted rate in the United States Navy and United States Coast Guard, ranking below petty officer third class and above seaman apprentice.
A merman; the male of the mermaid.
(of hair) Uncombed; dishevelled.
(by extension) Disorderly; untidy; messy; not kept up.
Rough; unpolished
An amount or power (especially electric), expressed in watts, kilowatts etc.
The power requirement of some electric appliance.
(of sound reproduction) having a single channel; monaural (compare stereophonic)
Having a single melodic line and no harmony (compare polyphonic)
Having simple one-to-one mapping between letters and phonemes
A type of hat, once worn by women or children, held in place by ribbons tied under the chin.
A traditional Scottish woollen brimless cap; a bunnet.
(by extension) The polishing head of a power buffer, often made of wool.
The hinged cover over the engine of a motor car; a hood.
A length of canvas attached to a fore-and-aft sail to increase the pulling power.
An accomplice of a gambler, auctioneer, etc., who entices others to bet or to bid.
The second stomach of a ruminant.
Anything resembling a bonnet (hat) in shape or use.
To put a bonnet on.
To take off the bonnet or cap as a mark of respect; to uncover.
To pull the bonnet or cap down over the head of.

The "false" (singing) voice in any human, usually airy and lacking a purity of vowels; created by utilizing the next highest vocal folds above those used for speech and normal range singing. It is commonly confused with the Head Voice register.
A person who sings in falsetto.
To sing or utter in falsetto.
A motion like that of waves; a moving in this and that direction.
definitions.example: the fluctuations of the sea

definitions.definition: A wavering; unsteadiness.
definitions.example: fluctuations of opinion

definitions.definition: In medicine, a wave-like motion or undulation of a fluid in a natural or abnormal cavity (e.g. pus in an abscess), which is felt during palpation or percussion.
A crop that is ploughed into the soil to improve its fertility
The person who makes a telephone call.
definitions.example: - I've got someone on the line.

definitions.definition: A visitor.
definitions.example: a gentleman caller

definitions.definition: (bingo) The person who stands at the front of the hall and announces the numbers.
A function that calls another (the callee).
A whistle or similar item used to call foxes.
The person who directs dancers in certain dances, such as American line dances and square dances.
The sound produced by the horn of a car, or any similar sound.
A short, electronically produced tone.
To sound (something that makes a beep).
definitions.example: The motorists in the traffic jam were getting more and more frustrated and started beeping their horns.

definitions.definition: To have sexual intercourse (with) - referring to the bleep tone used to censor obscene words in broadcasts
definitions.example: Jason beeped Sharlene after they had drunk a few beers.

definitions.definition: To produce a beep.
To contact (someone via) a pager device.
Telephoning a person, but only allowing the phone to ring once, in order to request a call back.
definitions.example: Susan beeped Jessica, and then Jessica called her back, because Susan didn't have enough credit on her phone to make the call.

definitions.definition: The headlining band or performer at a concert or similar event; the best-known and first billed musician, comedian, etc., often performing as the final act of the evening.
The interior fabric covering the roof of a vehicle.
Condition as to ancestors; ancestral lineage; hence, birth or honorable descent.
definitions.example: Title and ancestry render a good man more illustrious, but an ill one more contemptible. -Addison.

definitions.definition: A series of ancestors or progenitors; lineage, or those who compose the line of natural descent.
A prepubescent child.
A person younger than the age of majority; a minor.
A person younger than the age of full criminal responsibility, such that the person either cannot be held criminally liable or is subject to less severe forms of punishment.
A publication for young adult readers.
An actor playing a child's role.
A sexually immature animal.
A two-year-old racehorse.
Young; not fully developed.
Characteristic of youth or immaturity; childish.
A prefabricated building.
A prefabricated section of a building.
A single-storey prefabricated home built in many British cities immediately after World War II, intended to have a short life, but in a few cases still in use.
To prefabricate.
Prefabricated
A ball that does not bounce on the pitch before reaching the batsman.
Prayer, later especially with a rosary.
Each in a string of small balls making up the rosary or paternoster.
A small, round object.
(heading) A ridge, band, or molding.
Knowledge sufficient to direct one's activities to a purpose.
definitions.example: We now have a bead on the main technical issues for the project

definitions.definition: A glassy drop of molten flux, as borax or microcosmic salt, used as a solvent and color test for several mineral earths and oxides, as of iron, manganese, etc., before the blowpipe.
definitions.example: the borax bead;  the iron bead, etc.

definitions.definition: Front sight of a gun.
To form into a bead.
definitions.example: The raindrops beaded on the car's waxed finish.

definitions.definition: To apply beads to.
definitions.example: She spent the morning beading the gown.

definitions.definition: To form into a bead.
definitions.example: He beaded some solder for the ends of the wire.

definitions.definition: To cause beads to form on (something).
Speed bump
A Member of Parliament who does not have cabinet rank, and who therefore sits on one of the backbenches or in one of the back rows of the legislature.
A student who does not perform well, especially one who sits at the back of the classroom.
A member of a team who does not usually play, but who is held in reserve.
(by extension) Someone who does not play an active role in a process.
To prove satisfactory; to be successful or worthy of merit.
Of, or pertaining to, the Apocrypha.
(by extension) Of doubtful authenticity, or lacking authority; not regarded as canonical.
definitions.example: Many scholars consider the stories of the monk Teilo to be apocryphal.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Of dubious veracity; of questionable accuracy or truthfulness; anecdotal or in the nature of an urban legend.
definitions.example: There is an apocryphal tale of a little boy plugging the dike with his finger.

definitions.definition: A young bull.
A castrated bull; an ox.
To bully.
The final balance; the amount of money or profit left after everything has been tallied.
The summary or result; the most important information
definitions.example: The bottom line is that there simply are not enough hours in the day to finish all there is to do.

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the passive voice) To intimidate; to daunt the spirits or courage of.
definitions.example: Con artists are not cowed by the law.

definitions.definition: Frightened into submission.
A plant of the orchid family (Orchidaceae), bearing unusually-shaped flowers of beautiful colours.
A light bluish-red, violet-red or purple colour.
(colour) having a light purple colour.
Any of several varieties of thin cotton cloth.
Fabric made of cotton, flax (linen), hemp, or silk, finely or coarsely woven.
Any of a wide variety of tightly-woven thin fabrics, especially those used for bedlinen.
Woven cotton or linen fabrics, especially when used for items other than garments.
A dressmaker's pattern made from inexpensive cloth for fitting.
Any of several different moths, especially the muslin moth, Diaphora mendica.
A seal which can magically transform into a human by shedding its skin.
A chicken of a certain breed with very fine, silk-like feathers.
Similar in appearance or texture (especially in softness and smoothness) to silk.

definitions.definition: Smooth and pleasant; seductive.
definitions.example: a silky voice

definitions.definition: Covered in long, slender, glistening hairs pressed close to the surface; sericeous.
To install windows.
To apply a thin, transparent layer of coating.
To become glazed or glassy.
For eyes to take on an uninterested appearance.
A glazed donut, one with a coating such as sugar or chocolate.
Of eyes: showing no liveliness.
A biological hazard; a source of risk due to some biological factor such as bacteria or human waste.
A plastic film (originally polyvinylidene chloride but now polyethylene) that is so light and thin that it clings to any object about which it is wrapped; used to cover and preserve foodstuffs etc.
A serviced apartment complex that uses a hotel-style booking system.
(strictly) A person whose net worth is at or greater than one million units of the local currency, but less than two million.
A person whose net worth is at or greater than one million units of the local currency; a multimillionaire.
A beverage containing a combination of milk and tea.
Bubble tea.
A scoring system in which points are awarded based on the number of strokes used to sink the ball, as opposed to match play.
An irrational, abnormal, or obsessive fear (of something).
definitions.example: I know someone with a strange phobia of ladders.

definitions.definition: The throat or esophagus.
The cytopharynx of a ciliate, through which food is ingested.
The space between the teeth of a saw blade.
A channel for water.
A preparatory cut or channel in excavations, of sufficient width for the passage of earth wagons.
The wide room under the pommel of a saddle, the hollow over the withers.
Showing contempt; expressing disdain; showing a lack of respect.
definitions.example: I don't know that guy, but he just gave me a contemptuous look.

definitions.definition: A technique in poetry whereby a sentence is carried over to the next line without pause.
The most important person, the one who is in charge.
Someone who is top of a ranking, who is ranked first.
Oneself, being considered foremost, as by an egoist.
Urine; urination.
The single that has sold the most in a given period.
The main goalkeeper of a team, so-called because they wear the number 1 on the back of their kit.
The batsman who opens the batting.
A first lieutenant.
A large town where theatrical performances may expect to achieve success.
First; foremost; best, often used after its headword.
definitions.example: Commuting to work is the number one reason to own a car.

definitions.definition: A popular garden plant, of the genus Fuchsia, of the Onagraceae family, shrubs with red, pink or purple flowers.
A purplish-red colour, the color of fuchsin, an aniline dye.
Having a purplish-red colour.
A litter to transport the corpse of a dead person.
A platform or stand where a body or coffin is placed.
A count of forty threads in the warp or chain of woollen cloth.
Relating to the sky or outer space, regarded as the realm of the sun, moon, planets, and stars.
Of or pertaining to the highest degree of glory.
Of or pertaining to the heaven believed in by many religions.
Of or pertaining to the kingdom of God; divine.
Strongly or sublimely beautiful or pleasurable.
In a manner like that of heaven; by the influence or agency of heaven; divinely, miraculously.
To a degree such as to elicit great pleasure.
Extremely happy; full of joy; experiencing, indicating, causing, or characterized by bliss.
Blessed; glorified.
A loose shirt, usually made of a knit fleece, for athletic wear and now often used as casual apparel.
A shirt worn against the skin, usually under other clothing, to absorb sweat.
A Maori funeral.
To suffocate; stifle; obstruct, more or less completely, the respiration of something or someone.
To extinguish or deaden, as fire, by covering, overlaying, or otherwise excluding the air.
definitions.example: to smother a fire with ashes

definitions.definition: To reduce to a low degree of vigor or activity; suppress or do away with; extinguish
definitions.example: The committee's report was smothered.

definitions.definition: In cookery: to cook in a close dish.
definitions.example: beefsteak smothered with onions

definitions.definition: To daub or smear.
To be suffocated.
To breathe with great difficulty by reason of smoke, dust, close covering or wrapping, or the like.
(of a fire) to burn very slowly for want of air; smolder.
To perish, grow feeble, or decline, by suppression or concealment; be stifled; be suppressed or concealed.
To get in the way of a kick of the ball.

To get in the way of a kick of the ball, preventing it going very far. When a player is kicking the ball, an opponent who is close enough will reach out with his hands and arms to get over the top of it, so the ball hits his hands after leaving the kicker's boot, dribbling away.
That which smothers or appears to smother, particularly
One who agitates; one who stirs up or excites others, for example political reformers.
An implement for shaking or mixing.
One of a body of men appointed by the army, in Cromwell's time, to look after their interests; called also adjutators.
To achieve substantial success in life, often in business.
(often with "on") To complete successfully; to fulfil (a promise).
definitions.example: He made good his escape by jumping from a second-story window.

definitions.definition: To match the first player's bet with one's own, rather than dropping out.
To remedy or compensate for (a defect or deficiency).
definitions.example: The company made good the damage by paying my repair costs.

definitions.definition: To make (a surface) level or even.
A rare, black and white mammal Ailuropoda melanoleuca, commonly, but mistakenly known as the panda
A person who makes a deposit, especially a deposit of money in a bank
A pouch or sac without opening, usually membranous and containing morbid matter, which develops in one of the natural cavities or in the substance of an organ.
Of or pertaining to the urinary bladder or gall bladder (in compounds).
A phrase expressing a basic truth which may be applied to common situations.
A striking or paradoxical assertion; an obscure saying; an enigma; a parable.
A familiar illustration; a subject of contemptuous reference.
A drama exemplifying a proverb.
To write or utter proverbs.
To name in, or as, a proverb.
To provide with a proverb.
One of a family of dishes originating from South Asian cuisine, flavoured by a spiced sauce.
A spiced sauce or relish, especially one flavoured with curry powder.
Curry powder.
To cook or season with curry powder.
To groom (a horse); to dress or rub down a horse with a curry comb.
To dress (leather) after it is tanned by beating, rubbing, scraping and colouring.
To beat, thrash; to drub.
To try to win or gain (favour) by flattering.
To perform currying upon.
To scurry; to ride or run hastily
To cover (a distance); (of a projectile) to traverse (its range).
To hurry.
A site for mining stone, limestone, or slate.
definitions.example: Michelangelo personally quarried marble from the world-famous quarry at Carrara.

definitions.definition: A part of the entrails of a hunted animal, given to the hounds as a reward.
An animal, often a bird or mammal, which is hunted.
An object of search or pursuit.
A diamond-shaped tile or pane, often of glass or stone.
A tractor with an attached blade for pushing earth and building debris for coarse preliminary surface grading, demolishing building structures, etc.
One who bulldozes.

(chiefly in the plural) A member of a self-identified group of white US Southerners who colluded to influence outcomes of post-Reconstruction elections by intimidating, coercing and bullying black voters and legislators, including burning down houses and churches, flogging and murdering opponents.
(by extension) A bully; an overbearing individual.
To bulldoze (push through forcefully).
An appointed official tasked to regulate or oversee a specific area.
definitions.example: drug czar

definitions.definition: An emperor of Russia (1547 to 1917) and of some South Slavic states.
A person with great power; an autocrat.
Heat-treatment of a perishable food to destroy heat-sensitive vegetative cells followed by immediate cooling to limit growth of the surviving cells and germination of spores.
